thread.title: Manchester United’s Wayne Rooney is genuinely among the fastest footballers in the world
thread.title_full: Manchester United’s Wayne Rooney is genuinely among the fastest footballers in the world

author: markbrus88
title: Manchester United’s Wayne Rooney is genuinely among the fastest footballers in the world
text:
Just look at him go! (Picture: Getty) Real Madrid star Gareth Bale has been named as the fastest footballer in the world for the last year, but in a list that bizarrely includes Manchester United ‘s Wayne Rooney in 10th place.
Believe! 5 great Arsenal results in the CL to show there's hope against Bayern Yes, you read that correctly: the England captain, a faded force who seems to get out of breath after a light jog on the pitch these days (when he gets on it, that is), is apparently among the ten fastest footballers on the planet.
He joins less surprising names such as Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, Theo Walcott, Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, though there’s no sign of Arsenal speedster Hector Bellerin or Liverpool’s Sadio Mane.
World's fastest footballers (km/h) Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) 36.90 Orlandio Berrio (Flamengo) 36.00 Jurgen Damm (Tigres) 35.23 Antonio Valencia (Man Utd) 35.10 Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) 34.60 Aaron Lennon (Everton) 33.80 Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) 33.60 Theo Walcott (Arsenal) 32.70 Lionel Messi (Barcelona) 32.50 Wayne Rooney (Man Utd) 31.20 Share

How has this happened? The findings come from a study by Mexican outfit C.F Pachuca, who measured players’ maximum speed reached in the last year. In other words, Rooney may have briefly managed a very decent sprint, boosting his statistics even if he isn’t doing it on a regular basis, or to particularly useful effect. More: Football This is who's really to blame for Ozil's poor form, claims Man Utd legend 
Barcelona stars in stitches after Neymar turns up to training with new look 
The next Mkhitaryan? Man Utd legend backs frozen-out star to win Mourinho over 
Rooney is widely expected to be in his final season in a United shirt after falling out of favour and being linked with a big-money move to the Chinese Super League in the summer.
If these figures are anything to go by, he’ll have a field day running against defences in China and may be decent value at the £50billion-per-week* he’s set to earn in the Far East.
*May not be entirely accurate figures MORE: Anthony Martial backed to succeed at Manchester United by Gary Neville
